articles.summary: They projected a series of illustrations, demanding urgent action on the global debt crisis and climate accountability As Johannesburg readies to receive world leaders for the first G20 on African soil, a group of local South African artists teamed up with activists from the Glasgow Actions Team (GAT) to illuminate Johannesburg's skyline on Wednesday night. articles.title: Israeli fire kills four in Gaza , casting further doubt on ceasefire
articles.summary: Israeli airstrikes killed four people and wounded 18 others in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on Thursday, local health authorities said, as Hamas and Israel accused each other of violating a near six-week-old, U.S.-brokered ceasefire. articles.summary: News | Israel-Palestine conflict Explosive weapons caused record child deaths last year: Save the Children Deaths and injuries are at their highest levels since records began in 2006, and up by 42 percent on the 2020 total, the UK charity says. articles.title: NGO warns explosive weapons killed¬†record number of children in 2024
articles.summary: Palestinian children play with a swing among the ruins of a building, in the northern Gaza Strip November 19, 2025. MAHMOUD ISSA / REUTERS Explosive weapons killed or injured children at record levels last year, as wars increasingly move into urban areas, Save the Children said in a report published on Thursday, November 20. Nearly 12,000 children were killed or injured in conflict last year worldwide, said the UK-based charity, citing UN figures
